Eh...  Please don't flame me for this.  I just happen to work here. :)

JBuilder 4.0 foundation is built to have partially-completed features, 
as far as I believe.

If you have the advanced version (Professional or Enterprise), you will 
have the ability to filter the classes that you don't want to go to.

As for the usage of debugger, I found it very useful when an assertion 
failed unexpectedly, because I can check out the states of the instances 
to see where it went wrong.  Then I will add proper assertion statement 
to my test code, or even add another testing method so that next time 
the assertion will occur as early as possible.

-- 
Disclaimer:  I join all the news groups out of my own interest.  All opinions expressed here are my own and not necessarily those of my employer.


Russ Baker wrote:

>Hello,
>
>I have been stuck using jBuilder to debug my code.  Well, after fighting
>with the IDE for months now, I have come to the conclusion that, for lack of
>better verbiage, jBuilder's (4.0) debugger is flaky.  The debugger
>constantly goes into code that it shouldn't, and actually forces me to go
>back to using the old System.out method of debugging, how wasteful!
>
>Does anyone know of a decent debugger?  I am currently using the jdk1.3.1.
>
>Thanks in advance,
>
>Russ Baker
